Event.name: Board Games: Demo Games / Learn to Play

Event.description: Including Pathfinder Society, Shadowrun, Classic D&D, Fiasco, Leverage, Hunter Planet, Toon, FATE, Tiny Teddies Go To War, Dragon Age, Numenera
Event.name: RPG: Demo Games / Learn to Play

Event.description: Including Super Dungeon Explore, DUST, Warhammer 40K, X-Wing, Warmachine/Hordes, Ronin/SAGA, Flames of War, MERCS
Event.name: Miniatures: Demo Games / Learn to Play

Event.description: Including Speed painting, Paint & take, Painting workshops
Event.name: Miniatures: Painting events

Event.description: How are games and other media crossing over and evolving together? We have all seen adaptations of books, films, and comics into games and vice versa, but now games are becoming instrumental to the development of story in other media. -- Panelists: Our panel of gaming and media experts discuss gaming in other media or using gaming to expand a story. Have your chance to listen in on a group of game and media producers, comic writers and artists, and ask your questions, as we explore - where are we going next?
Event.name: Unlocking The Fourth Wall: Transmedia and Games

Event.description: Gearbox Software is back at PAX Australia! This is your opportunity to take a behind the scenes look at Gearbox Software and get the latest news and updates on our games including Borderlands, Battleborn and Homeworld Remastered! We will have never before seen reveals, exclusives and surprises so don’t miss your chance to hang out with the Gearbox crew at PAX Australia!
Event.name: Inside Gearbox Software

Event.description: Isn't "cosplay" just something people do for fun at conventions once or twice a year? What even is a "Professional Cosplayer?" The world of cosplay is a constantly growing and evolving universe. We discuss the changing landscape of nerdy dress ups, and if in the age of social media "cosplay celebrity" actually exists. Whether you're a hardcore costumer or you've never stepped foot into the real world with your underpants on the outside, come along and help us solve the mystery of cosplay fame. -- Panelists: Eve Beauregard [Entertainer, The Witcher 3/CD Projekt RED], Rae Johnston [Tech Journalist, Surprise Attack], Ardella [Cosplayer, Planet of the Capes/Kapow], Dave Callan [Comedian, Good Game]
Event.name: Dawn of the Planet of the Cosplay Celebrity
Towerfall, You Don't Know Jack, Ice Rage
Board Games: A Game of Games

Event.description: Mobile gaming is synonymous with casual, snack-sized gaming and mobile gamers expect to get them for free or a dollar. Yet mobile is also home to some phenomenal gaming experiences that are unique to the form and are successfully charging a fair price. -- Panelists: Meet the developers of three such games - The Room, Monument Valley and Framed - as the panel discusses why mobile is a great platform for independent developers & gamers looking for unique experiences and why it's worth paying for mobile games.
Event.name: Swimming against the tide with premium indie mobile games

Event.description: Be among the first gamers in the world to see what's coming up in the world's best strategy trading card game, Magic: The Gathering! Join special guest Aaron Forsythe (Director of R&D for Magic: The Gathering) in person as he showcases upcoming products, events and even a preview or two. Of course, if you've got any burning questions about Magic you've always wanted to ask Wizards, you'll have an opportunity to ask Aaron and the team directly in our Q&A session! -- Panelists: Will Chan [Brand Manager APAC, Hasbro Australia], Aaron Forsythe [Director of R&D Magic, Wizards of the Coast], Dale Aitken [Regional Manager APAC, Hasbro Australia]
Event.name: Magic:The Gathering with Aaron Forsythe (Director, MTG R&D)

Event.description: Jay Anthony Franke is the voice actor who not only provided the voice of JC and Paul Denton, but also worked on the dev team that created the Gaming Classic, Deus Ex. Please join us as Jay recalls stories and anecdotes of how this Legendary game to be. This will be a 45 minute presentation/interview followed by a 15 minute audience Q&A. -- Panelists: Jay Anthony Franke [Voice Actor/ Game Developer], Peter Mars [Interviewer]
Event.name: I am JC Denton: A Conversation With Jay Anthony Franke

Event.description: Did your Femshep court Liara in Mass Effect? Did the limited relationships in Tomodachi Life cramp your style? In The Sims, are your little digital people Woohooing with male and female neighbours? Was the best thing about Saint's Row IV the gender-blind character editor? This panel aims to talk about gaming diversity, in the players, characters, and game creators. Which games get sex and gender diversity right, and which ones could try a little harder? Join our diverse panel to discuss it! -- Panelists: James Dominguez [Games writer, Fairfax Media], Alice Clarke [Columnist, News Ltd.], Jade Starr [Musician, Independent performer], Lysander Wilkins [Designer and artist, Wonderworld Games]
Event.name: Play the Rainbow: Diversity in video games

Event.description: Have you ever wanted to try create a cosplay by yourself but don't know where to start? Come join Yasmin, Aly & K and learn some new techniques and skills in how to take your cosplay from concept, choosing and sourcing the right fabrics and materials, patterning and fabricating - plus some makeup & wig tips to complete your cosplay look! -- Panelists: K (Christine Busby) [K & Aly Cosplay], Aly (Alyssea Nicole) [K & Aly Cosplay], Yas (Yasemin Arslan) [Yasemin Arslan]
Event.name: Cosplay Unlocked: Fabricating Cosplays from Scratch

Event.description: Come along to Weird And Retro's Retro Roadshow and bring along your rarest and/or favourite video gaming item. Audience members will have the chance to be selected and talk about the items brought. -- Panelists: Aleks Svetislav [Director, Weird And Retro], Kane Watters [Muscle, Weird And Retro], Pedro Batista [Collector Extraordinaire, Weird And Retro]
Event.name: Retro Roadshow

Event.description: Over the last decade, through economic fluctuations and a changing market, the triple-A presence in Australia has shrunk. In response, our developers have created healthy indie scenes, capable of supporting themselves and punching above their weight. -- Panelists: In July of this year, we took a team of Aussie indies to Oman to mentor attendees of the country's very first game dev workshop. Hear our story, and why Aussie independent know-how is exactly what's needed in regions we never thought of.
Event.name: Exporting Aussie Indie Culture

Event.description: Hand Held devices have massively expanded and altered the gaming landscape. Independent developers have lead the way in this new frontier. But while we've enthusiastically embraced mobile gaming, when it comes to paying, we're not nearly so keen. Developers have responded with various funding models in order to make a living. But what is the impact on the creative process and ultimately who are the winners and losers? -- Panelists: Bajo [Presenter, Good Game], Barry Meade [CEO, Fireproof Studios], Rami Ismail [CEO, Vlambeer], Phil Larsen [Chief Marketing Officer, Half Brick], Leigh Harris [CEO, Flat Earth Games]
Event.name: Pay vs Fremium - the impact on Creativity

Event.description: Want the inside word on how games journalism and criticism is changing? The GameSpot AU staff, who cover a range of field experience from print, online, video and YouTube, present their first-hand perspective, followed by an open Q&A. -- Panelists: Daniel Hindes [Editor, GameSpot], Zorine Te [Associate Editor, GameSpot], Jessica McDonell [Video Journalist, GameSpot], Edmond Tran [Video Director, GameSpot]
Event.name: The Changing Face of Games Journalism, featuring GameSpot

Event.description: Wanting to take your kids LAN party to the next level? Seeking information on playing Warhammer with primary schoolers? Wondering what new board game to play with your eight-year-old? Do you know about Makedo? About Makey Makey? Or how to teach your kid to code? Our panel of Geek parents know all this and more. They have parenting experience from babies through to teenagers. They will come armed with an arsenal of geeky games and ideas from the parenting trenches to help you raise your geeklets. -- Panelists: Daniel Donahoo [Contributor & GeekDad, GeekDad], Rae Johnston [Technology and Gaming advocate/TV presenter, Channel Nine's MORNINGS], Giselle Rosman [Events Coordinator & GeekMum, IGDA Melbourne], Craig Peebles [Game Developer & GeekDad, Freelance], Luke Bennett [Occasional Contributor, GeekDad]
Event.name: Geek Parenting: Games & activities for your geeklets

Event.description: Wait, they do even more panels!? These guys are the best! Come meet the hardest working duo in the online jpeg racket. Gabe and Tycho field your questions and entertain you because hey, you deserve it. -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho!
Event.name: Penny Arcade Q&A #2

Event.description: We always hear about people who knew they wanted to make games in kindergarten - but what if you didn't? What if you wanted to be a vet, or an undertaker, or an architect? What about if you didn't realise you wanted to be a game developer until after you'd spent years being something else? -- Panelists: ...all is not lost! In fact, you might actually be in a better position to make games than those people who've not tried anything else.
Event.name: The importance of diverse skillsets when making games

Event.description: Game reviews are an ethical minefield and we're here to blow it up. A group of Australian reviewers working in different mediums will be breaking down all of the important questions; what is the actual purpose of game reviews? Can reviews be objective, and should they be? Are numbered review scores even effective? Should you review a game if a friend of yours works for that company? Do game reviewers really get paid off, or is it all one giant myth!? Come and join us to find out! -- Panelists: Alanah Pearce [Presenter/Game Reviewer, Outfox], Joab Gilroy [Podcast Host/Game Reviewer, Aus Gamers], Dan Hindes [Editor/Game Reviewer, GameSpot], Lucy O'Brien [Entertainment Editor, IGN], James O'Connor [Editor/Game Reviewer, Freelance]
Event.name: Game Reviews: Criticising the Critics

Event.description: Why are religious games so bad? It hasn't stopped the industry from being obsessed with religion and spirituality in general. From Skyrim to Civilization, Diablo and beyond, video games have used spirituality and religions for years as mechanics and plot devices. But are these "religious" games? Are the spiritual themes stand-ins for common fantasy themes, or is there something deeper going on? Join a spiritually diverse panel to tackle these and other big religious questions. -- Panelists: Patrick Stafford [Freelance Journalist, Hyper Magazine, Polygon, Eurogamer, PC PowerPlay, The Atlantic], Nathan Cocks [Freelance Journalist, PC PowerPlay, Hyper Magazine], Jason Imms [Freelance Journalist, Games.On.Net, Hyper Magazine], Mark Serrels [Editor, Kotaku Australia]
Event.name: Spiritual Warfare: Religion and Spirituality in Video Games

Event.description: Media Molecule are responsible for creating Little Big Planet and Tearaway. They are the Triple A developers with the big heart - committed to developing games that immerse the player in beautiful virtual worlds that transcend age, gender and cultural differences. Key to the MM gaming experience is enabling the player to use their original tools to create their own game worlds. This panel will explore Mm's rationale to game design and building communities of like-minded gamers. -- Panelists: Gus "Goose" Ronald [Presenter, Good Game], Siobhan Reddy [Studio Manager, Media Molecule], Rex Crowle [Creative Lead, Media Molecule], James Spafford [Community Manager, Media Molecule]
Event.name: Media Molecule - Ask us about our games!

Event.description: Calling all game changers! Serious Games and Games for Change are a rising star in the game industry, but what is it that makes a game, a ‘serious game’? Have you ever wondered about the impact of serious games? Or maybe you’ve thought about making one yourself? Come to our panel and learn about what makes these games seriously powerful, why you should care and how you can be a part of this new generation of games for positive change. -- Panelists: Jane Cocks [University of Sunshine Coast], Izzy Gramp [Independent], Dan Monceaux [Danimations Pty Ltd], Amani Naseem [Copenhagen Game Collective], Paul Stapelberg [Well Placed Cactus]
Event.name: Let's get Serious: Games are changing, get involved!

Event.description: Team up with the Dicestormers as they gird their loins and set off to parts unknown in search of treasure and glory. Along the way they'll face deadly perils, brought to life with the aid of map visualization tool Dungeon Mapp, experience the amazing sounds of Syrinscape and use game mechanics and NPCs sourced from none other than you, our audience! Does adventure and glory await? Are their loins sufficiently girded? What will become of our intrepid heroes? Only you can help us find out! -- Panelists: Derek Proud [Director, Ambitious Software], Ben Loomes [Creative Director, Syrinscape], Nathan Bennett [Actor, Dicestormers], Johnny Sharpe [Actor, Dicestormers], Murray Dahm [Actor, Dicestormers], Jon Wright [Actor, Dicestormers]
Event.name: Live RPG++

Event.description: Producing the hit show TableTop, created and hosted by Wil Wheaton, has taught game designer Boyan Radakovich a deeper understanding of what makes tabletop games successful. Learn new key concepts gained from creating the show such as: maximizing fun efficiency, creating a shared narrative for the players, the power of visual presentation, and many other techniques to take your game design to the next level. Join in the conversation and help grow our global gaming community! -- Panelists: Boyan Radakovich [Producer / Creative Director, Geek & Sundry / Gamesmith]
Event.name: Game Design Lessons from Producing TableTop

Event.description: 15+ -- Panelists: Do you prefer sticking to the shadows and remaining unseen? Is a silent takedown more satisfying than going in guns blazing? Or is the ultimate rush finishing a level without anyone ever knowing you were there? Join Sneaky Bastards editor Daniel Hindes and Far Cry 4 Creative Director Alex Hutchinson for a look at how stealth gaming has come back to the forefront and is better than ever.
Event.name: Stealth Gaming featuring Far Cry 4

Event.description: Australians have been making amazing video games for 30 years but it’s fair to say that the last few years have been a difficult time for local developers. -- Panelists: Hosted by Kotaku’s Mark Serrels, the panel will discuss what is happening now and what the governments, developers, publishers, investors, educators and gamers can do to help forge a bright and exciting future for the Australian development scene.
Event.name: Where to now for Australian Game Development?
